column1: #! The organisation which owns the text.
#! The organisation which owns the site from which the text was obtained (eg DBL).  Defaults to owner organisation if not supplied.

#! Sword config file.  Parameters from other sections in this data also appear here, but these are the things which are specific to the Sword config file – either things which Sword requires as parameters, or things which appear in our admin comments.

#! Compound fields and their content.  You _can_ override these if you need to, but bear in mind that the compound field definitions are intended to generate a measure of standardisation between different texts.
#! Other things you may want to include.  These go at the bottom of the generated configuration information.  They need to be complete configuration statements.
#! Preprocessing.  These are used very rarely (and indeed they haven't been used for a long time, and therefore may not be working at present.)
#! Reference formats – used when parsing or creating references in vernacular format.
#! Used purely internally and not intended to be overridden.
#! Debug.  These haven't been used for a long time, and for all I know, may not still work – or at any rate, may not do what they suggest.
#! Things where I have retained existing processing, but am not presently using.
#! Command line.  (On the command line, all of these have names devoid of 'step'.  'step' is added when the parameters are stored in the config data structure internally.

#! Environment variable: things which, if supplied at all, would normally be placed in the stepTextConverterParameters environment variable.  Other things _can_ go here too; and some of the things listed here _could_ go elsewhere.
#! Constant values -- things set up to save having to duplicate them all over the place.
